title.value: A Generic Framework for Byzantine-tolerant Consensus Achievement in Robot Swarms
title.justification: This is the exact title listed at the beginning of the provided text.
title.quote:
A Generic Framework for
Byzantine-tolerant Consensus Achievement in Robot Swarms

extractions.description: The paper discusses a generic framework that uses blockchain and smart contracts to achieve consensus in robot swarms in the presence of Byzantine robots, applying the concept to swarm robotics foraging tasks and comparing the approach with existing protocols.

type.justification: The paper involves practical implementation and validation of a proposed framework using experiments and comparisons with existing protocols.
type.quote: We validate our framework using an experimental scenario...

name.justification: The research focuses on consensus achievement in robot swarms, a primary area within swarm robotics.
name.quote: As a discipline which originated from imitating the collective behaviour of living organisms, over the years swarm robotics research has intensively studied consensus achievement in a population of robots.

name.justification: The integration of blockchain technology with swarm robotics is prominently discussed.
name.quote: Recent studies show that some security features that blockchains grant to decentralized networks can be ported to swarm robotics.

name.justification: The framework addresses consensus achievement using byzantine-tolerant protocols in robot swarms.
name.quote: blockchain-based mechanisms are tailored to a particular swarm task and operating environment.

name.justification: The paper compares its framework against the LCP.
name.quote: We compare our approach with two baseline consensus algorithms, namely, the linear consensus (LCP) [29]...

is_contributed.justification: LCP is used as a baseline for comparison, not contributed by the paper.
is_contributed.quote: We compare our approach with two baseline consensus algorithms, namely, the linear consensus (LCP) [29]...

is_executed.justification: LCP is executed as a baseline for performance comparison.
is_executed.quote: We compare our approach with two baseline consensus algorithms, namely, the linear consensus (LCP) [29]...

is_compared.justification: LCP is directly compared with the proposed method.
is_compared.quote: We compare our approach with two baseline consensus algorithms, namely, the linear consensus (LCP) [29]...

referenced_paper_title.value: Trading accuracy for speed in approximate consensus
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference to LCP is as a baseline algorithm, and the cited work discusses it conceptually.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Trading accuracy for speed in approximate consensus [29].

name.justification: W-MSR is another protocol used for comparison in the study.
name.quote: We compare our approach with two baseline consensus algorithms, namely, the linear consensus (LCP) [29] and weighted-mean-subsequence reduced (W-MSR) protocols [45].

is_contributed.justification: W-MSR is used for comparison purposes only.
is_contributed.quote: We compare our approach with two baseline consensus algorithms, namely, the linear consensus (LCP) [29] and weighted-mean-subsequence reduced (W-MSR) protocols [45].

is_executed.justification: W-MSR is executed in the study for comparative analysis.
is_executed.quote: We compare our approach with two baseline consensus algorithms, namely, the linear consensus (LCP) [29] and weighted-mean-subsequence reduced (W-MSR) protocols [45].

is_compared.justification: W-MSR is compared with the proposed framework.
is_compared.quote: We compare our approach with two baseline consensus algorithms, namely, the linear consensus (LCP) [29] and weighted-mean-subsequence reduced (W-MSR) protocols [45].

referenced_paper_title.value: Resilient asymptotic consensus in robust networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper uses the W-MSR protocol concept originating from another referenced study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Resilient asymptotic consensus in robust networks [45].

name.justification: Ethereum is explicitly mentioned as the platform for implementing the smart contracts.
name.quote: ...implemented it as a meta controller using an Ethereum smart contract.

referenced_paper_title.value: Ethereum: A secure decentralised generalised transaction ledger.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The concept and application of Ethereum in implementing the described smart contracts is central to the paper's implementation.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Ethereum: A secure decentralised generalised transaction ledger. [14].
